response.job_title: Renewable Energy Systems | Process Engineer | Digitalisation Leader
response.summary:
As a curious engineer, my passion for research and design has driven my learning processes, allowing me to explore diverse fields and discover my deep interest in Energy & Resources Projects, especially those looking to accelerate a safer and greener energy future. That's why I enjoy contributing to motivated interdisciplinary teams with my abilities to delve into details and familiarize myself autonomously with uncommon subjects, always ready to face the next challenge.

After holding a variety of roles in different projects, superior organizational skills and a comprehensive understanding of teams' dynamics allow me to contribute to positive working atmospheres (always building on a good cup of coffee with the team).

Thanks to the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) and its scholarships, my communicative and intercultural skills have reached a level to perform ideally in contexts surrounded by different languages and cultures to create symbiotic relationships inter and intradisciplinary.

If you share my vision of a greener future and are willing to take hands-on shaping, let us get together to test our current "beta version" and grow up together. 

I'm right over at nico.miranda.h@gmail.com

AKA/Misspellings: Niklas, Nicholas, Nicolás.
response.skills: Pipeline Design, Heat Exchangers, MATLAB, PIPEPHASE, Smart Plant, Smart P&ID, SQL Server Management Studio, Due Diligence, Solar PV, Tenders, Fuel Cells, Hydrogen, Renewable Energy Systems, Energy Systems, Renewable Energy, Systems Modeling, Refrigeration, System Simulation, Heat Transfer, Research

profile_positions.description:
• Design of digitalization strategies for the Oil & Gas and Energy industry.
• Management of databases, digital sites and digital plants hosting smart engineering drawings in Smart P&ID.
• Setup and test of digital plants for integration of engineering projects (process, piping, instrumentation, rotating/static equipment) in SPID, S3D, SI and SE.
• Definition of interdisciplinary workflows for Quality Assurance of smart deliverables.
profile_positions.title: Domain Administrator - Smart P&ID

profile_positions.description:
• Analysis of technical and economic aspects of CO2 transport and storage (CCUS) for implementing blue hydrogen projects.
• Consolidation of studies and reports on optimizing energy consumption in pumping systems and heat exchange networks to reduce operating costs and carbon footprint.
• Evaluation of technical specifications for procurement of equipment for fluid processing and transportation (tanks, pumps, control valves, heat exchangers, e.t.c).
• Design of hydraulic networks integrated with third-party polymer packages for implementation of Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) technologies.
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
• Revamping facilities to increase capacity for oil, natural gas and waste water treatment.
• Analyzing heat-exchanger networks for stabilization of oil cuts produced within refinery facilities.
• Design of relief pressure networks for Upstream/Downstream facilities using Aspen Flare System Analyzer -AFSA (FlareNET) according to API Standards.
profile_positions.title: Junior Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
• Analyzed heat exchange strategies to meet environmental regulation for material discharged to the atmosphere.
• Prepared process diagrams such as blocks, PFD, P&ID, and 3D drawings for equipment construction.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Generated teaching material for 50 students regarding the simulation of chemical processes in licensed software and exploration of CAPE-OPEN interfaces.
• Tutored six research projects (per semester) in topics such as Hydraulic evaluation of columns, electrolytic systems, ASTM standards for crude oil characterization, and others.
profile_positions.title: Tutor for the "Modeling and Simulation of Chemical Processes" lecture

profile_positions.description:
• Planned high-pressure experiments to analyze interface interaction in three-phase systems (solid-liquid-vapor).
• Characterized surfaces exposed to corrosion quantitatively in sour media simulated experiments for CCS (Carbon Capture & Storage) technologies.
profile_positions.title: Internship Trainee

profile_positions.description:
• Consolidated desk-research regarding production techniques of carbon monolayers.
• Executed experiments for the production of carbon coatings through electrophoretic methods.
profile_positions.title: Laboratory Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Generated teaching material for learning concepts such as cubic equations of state, Gibbs free energy, and excess properties through user-programmed routines in Visual Basic.
• Improved semesterly final grades average in 0.3 units.
profile_positions.title: Tutor for the "Chemical Thermodynamics" lecture

profile_positions.description:
• Led an interdisciplinary team of five people.
• Consolidated documentation for applications developed for users at the economy faculty.
• Standardized processes carried out by the office staff, improving communication protocols.
• Planned and executed economic experiments aided by Z-tree software.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Researcher/ Team leader

education.degree_name: Master's degree, Renewable Energy Systems - Environmental and Process Engineering

company.name: IDOM Consulting, Engineering, Architecture
company.description:
IDOM is a leading multinational company providing professional services in consulting, engineering and architecture. One of its competitive advantages is the exceptional level of commitment it offers its clients, accompanying them through all phases of their projects.

Since its foundation in 1957, IDOM has worked on all five continents, carefully maintaining its independence from financial or interest groups, thus guaranteeing independence and impartiality in the global services delivered.

With a team of more than 5,000 professionals of 70 different nationalities, IDOM has the capacity and expertise to tackle complex large-scale projects with a multidisciplinary approach.

IDOM is an employee-owned organization with 968 partners form all areas and levels of the company. This ownership structure creates a culture of engagement and collaboration, breaking down the barriers of operating in a global market.
